name: Chalk
description: Because of its limited solubility it is only effective when added directly to the mash. Use for making dark beers in areas of soft water. Use nomograph and monitor the mash pH with pH test papers to determine how much to add.

name: Gypsum
description: Useful for adding calcium if the water is low in sulfate. Can be used to add sulfate "crispness" to the hop bitterness.

name: Calcium Chloride
description: Useful for adding Calcium if the water is low in chlorides.

name: Epsom Salt
effects: Lowers pH by a small amount.
description: Can be used to add sulfate "crispness" to the hop bitterness.

name: Baking Soda
description: If your pH is too low and/or has low residual alkalinity, then you can add alkalinity. See procedure for calcium carbonate.
